member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupMethod
member.summary: The CleanupMethod enum must strictly follow the following format: 0 = RowAgeAndRowCount, 1 = RowAge, 2 = RowCount.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupMethod.RowAgeAndRowCount
member.summary: Combo cleanup method uses both row age and row count to filter and clean the table.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupMethod.RowAge
member.summary: RowAge cleanup method will filter and clean rows based on how old they are.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupMethod.RowCount
member.summary: RowCount cleanup method will filter and clean the oldest rows once the table reaches a threshold capacity.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupRow
member.summary: This references a generic row that has to be cleaned up. It contains a primary key and a time stamp.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupRow.PrimaryKey
member.summary: The primary key of a given row.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupRow.Timestamp
member.summary: The time stamp of a given row.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.Filters.TableMaxRowCondition
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TableFilters class that contains the filters to apply to the TableData class.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.Filters.TableMaxRowCondition.Filters
member.summary: These Filters are to be used on the TableData class and can be either of CleanupMethod NA, Combo, RowAge or RowCount.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.Filters.TableMaxRowCondition.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is to register the cleanup parameters.
member.param: This is the cleanup methods that will be used.
This is the parameter ID for the maximum amount of rows in the table.
This is the parameter ID for the maximum age of rows in the table. This parameter should be configured in seconds.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.Filters.TableMaxRowCondition.RemovedPrimaryKeys
member.summary: The primary keys that will be removed.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.Filters.TableMaxRowCondition.Execute(Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol,System.Collections.Generic.List{Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupRow})
member.summary: Apply the condition on the rows to find the keys to remove.
member.param: This is needed to get the settings of the filter.
The rows that will be checked on.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.Interfaces.IFilter
member.summary: An interface for the filters to be implemented to clean and filter the table.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.Interfaces.IFilter.RemovedPrimaryKeys
member.summary: Contains the primary keys that are removed by the cleaning and filtering methods from the table.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.Interfaces.IFilter.Execute(Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol,System.Collections.Generic.List{Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.CleanupRow})
member.summary: This will apply the filter on the rows
member.param: This is needed to retrieve the values of the settings of the filter.
These are the rows where the filter will be executed on.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.SubFilters.MaximumAgeCondition
member.summary: The maximum age of the rows allowed on the table that implements the IFilter interface.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.SubFilters.MaximumAgeCondition.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: The maximum age allowed by the filter that cleans all rows with timestamps older than the given seconds provided.
member.param: The threshold age allowed of the oldest rows given in seconds.
member.exception: An exception thrown if the threshold time is invalid.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.SubFilters.MaximumAgeCondition.RemovedPrimaryKeys
member.summary: The primary keys deleted and taken out of the table after filtering.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.SubFilters.MaximumRowCountCondition
member.summary: The maximum row count allowed on the table that implements the IFilter interface.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.SubFilters.MaximumRowCountCondition.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The constructor class for the MaximumRowCountFilter.
member.param: The max rows that should be allowed for the table.
The number of rows to be deleted when the table reaches its max capacity.
member.exception: Exception thrown if the given parameters are invalid.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.SubFilters.MaximumRowCountCondition.DeletionAmount
member.summary: The parameter setting the number of rows to be deleted when the table reaches its max capacity.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.SubFilters.MaximumRowCountCondition.MaxRowCount
member.summary: The parameter setting the max rows that should be allowed for the table.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.SubFilters.MaximumRowCountCondition.RemovedPrimaryKeys
member.summary: The parameter with the collection of primary keys of the rows that are removed from the table.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableCleaner
member.summary: The class containing the row data that needs to be cleaned and filtered.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableCleaner.#ctor(Skyline.DataMiner.Scripting.SLProtocol,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: This constructor should be used if you want to cleanup on all the options.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableCleaner.WithCondition(Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.Interfaces.IFilter)
member.summary: Add a condition that has to be applied on the rows.
member.param: The filter that will be applied.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.Utils.TableCleanup.TableCleaner.Cleanup
member.summary: The cleanup method will execute all the conditions that where added.
